author: Patrick Allan
title: Plex Gets Alexa Voice Support On All Amazon Devices

organizations.name: alexa voice support on all amazon devices

text:
If you have an Amazon Echo, Echo Dot, Amazon Fire TV, or other Alexa-enabled device, you can now use your voice to play your Plex music, movies, and TV shows. Advertisement 
That’s right, you can now access all of your Plex media library with just the sound of your voice. To get it set up, just ask Alexa on your preferred Amazon device to enable the Plex skill . You’ll go through a quick account-linking process, then you can ask her to “open Plex.” 
Once the Plex skill is up and running, you can give Alexa commands like “Alexa, tell Plex to play Jurassic Park ,” “Alexa, tell Plex to play music by The Decemberists,” and if you’re having a hard time picking a movie, “Alexa, ask Plex to suggest something to watch.” You can see it in action in the video above, but here’s a complete list of commands .
